column5: Don't know if you can imagine these pictures.Unreal what's coming on.https://www.facebook.com/10150130473...6028706125153/

Prov- Have seen the FB updates from the Clark's on opening the camps. Yikes this is some high water. I know the last year we could fish before COVD it was just the opposite with low water levels and it made some of our adventures/boat rides a challenge. Always something for the outfitters to deal with and I hope the levels go down a bit before the season gets into full gear..
Also a challenge with high water with floating debris, and if any bogs broke loose.
All camps are having problems with high water.cant see levels dropping for a while yet.
Low water always better than high water.
Don't tell that to the people that rely on Lake Mead !
I mostly just tell the people in New Orleans.

Plenty of water in lake mead there good to go,they just have cut back alittle on the usage,From what I read from lakes being very low there finding people they were looking for,for many years,low water is good for the po po,bad for the criminal.
